titles.secondary: It's all about those Songs for Guy.

synopses.short: Guy picks some of his favourite Song for Guy suggestions from Finest Hour listeners.
synopses.medium: Guy picks some of his favourite Song for Guy suggestions from Finest Hour listeners.  Plus his featured artists are the wonderful REM.
synopses.long:
Guy picks some of his favourite Song for Guy suggestions from Finest Hour listeners.

Also, his featured artists are the wonderful REM, and there's a Rabbit Hole taking the scenic route from Christine and the Queens to Chet Baker.

synopses.short: Elbow frontman Guy Garvey brings his own unique taste to 6 Music.
synopses.medium: Elbow frontman Guy Garvey brings his own unique taste to 6 Music.

synopses.short: Dr Sian Williams charts the story of Gareth Williams, the codebreaker found naked in a bag
synopses.medium: In part five of Death of a Codebreaker, Dr Sian Williams explores suggestions his private life may have been linked to Gareth Williams' death
synopses.long:
Young Welshman Gareth Williams was found naked inside a relatively small bag in his bath in 2010. And another theory is that he was the victim of a bizarre sex game gone wrong. There are suggestions he may have had an interest in Claustrophilia - pleasure derived from being in a confined space. But how much evidence is there? Here Dr Sian Williams looks at what we know and don't know about Gareth's private life.

Death of a Codebreaker is presented by Dr Sian Williams with contributions in Episode 5 from James Pepper, Ashley Byrne, Tracy Cardwell and Wayne Wright.
Producers: James Pepper, Ashley Byrne and Wayne Wright
The Executive Producer is Ashley Byrne..
Music by Robin Forrest
The Sound editor: Kevin Bailey
Death of a Codebreaker is an MIM Production for BBC Sounds and BBC Radio Wales.

synopses.short: The Welsh codebreaker whose naked body was found inside a bag in his bath in 2010.
synopses.medium: Dr Sian Williams investigates the story of the Welsh codebreaker whose naked body was found inside a bag in his bath. Mystery still surrounds how and why Gareth Williams died.

warnings.long: Contains scenes of a sexual nature.

synopses.short: Kirsty Young talks to Guy Garvey, musician and frontman of Elbow.
synopses.medium: Kirsty Young talks to Guy Garvey, musician and frontman of Elbow.
synopses.long:
Guy Garvey, musician and frontman of Elbow, is interviewed by Kirsty Young for Desert island Discs.

Front man of the group "Elbow" his voice and lyrics have helped the band win pretty much every music prize going ... headlining Glastonbury too, and playing at the closing ceremony of the London Olympics. Yet his image is that of an everyday, low key, unassuming bloke ... except that he isn't, he's penning and performing songs filled with intimacy, optimism and lyricism, that strike a chord with millions of fans.

For a long while his devotees were well versed in the art of delayed gratification - Elbow's debut album was released 11 years after the band members first made music together.

He writes his songs in his journal and has been keeping a diary since he was 14. Maybe it was the peace and calm of the blank page that first appealed - one of 7 kids he says he was brought up "in a house full of women that were singing, shouting, arguing, fighting over the bathroom. I'm ruined by these women, spoilt rotten".

synopses.short: Castaway guests share the soundtrack of their lives.
synopses.medium: Eight tracks, a book and a luxury: what would you take to a desert island? Guests share the soundtrack of their lives.

titles.secondary: Iggy welcomes Tom Waits to the Confidential Show

synopses.short: The Grammy Award-winning musician Tom Waits co-hosts a special show with Iggy Pop.
synopses.medium: Echoing their famous joint appearance in Jim Jarmusch’s Coffee and Cigarettes, the show sees Iggy and Tom pump the Confidential jukebox full of nickels and dimes.
synopses.long:
Echoing their famous joint appearance in Jim Jarmusch’s Coffee and Cigarettes, the show sees Iggy and Tom pump the Confidential jukebox full of nickels and dimes.

Songs include Bangkok by Alex Chilton, Moon River by Frank Ocean and Colorado Kool-Aid by Johnny Paycheck, as well as the first spoken word song Tom heard on the radio and a couple of 60s TV theme tunes to raise a smile.

synopses.short: Iggy Pop returns to 6 Music with more eclectic and exciting music choices.
synopses.medium: Iggy Pop, the 'godfather of punk', returns to 6 Music with more eclectic and exciting music choices, giving listeners an exclusive insight into his mind.

synopses.short: How an accountant from Stoke gambled it all to become the world's highest paid woman.
synopses.medium: How did an accountant from Stoke gamble it all to become the world's highest paid woman? Simon Jack and Zing Tsjeng judge an elusive billionaire who made her money on betting.
synopses.long: How did an accountant from Stoke-on-Trent gamble it all to become the world's highest paid woman? Denise Coates founded online betting company Bet365 and soon became a billionaire. BBC business editor Simon Jack and journalist Zing Tsjeng trace the journey of this elusive figure. Geographically she's not travelled far, becoming the biggest employer in her hometown of Stoke-on-Trent. But as a businesswoman she's dominated the online gambling market globally, earning an annual salary that peaked at £421 million. In the podcast that uncovers how the world's wealthiest people made their money and asks if they are good or bad for the planet, Simon and Zing judge the woman who made billions from betting.

synopses.short: Find out how billionaires got so rich: are they good, bad, or just another billionaire?
synopses.medium: Simon Jack and Zing Tsjeng find out how the richest people on the planet made their billions, and then they judge them. Are they good, bad, or just another billionaire?
synopses.long:
Simon Jack and Zing Tsjeng find out how the richest people on the planet made their billions, and then they judge them. Are they good, bad, or just another billionaire?

Good Bad Billionaire is here to lift the curtain on the minds, motives and money of some of the world's wealthiest individuals. Hosted by Simon Jack, Business Editor for BBC News, and journalist, author and podcaster Zing Tsjeng, this ground-breaking new series examines the rise of a different billionaire each week to answer the question: Are they good, bad, or just another billionaire?

From Silicon Valley tech titans and secretive CEOS, to Wall Street moguls, pop stars and sporting legends, Simon and Zing will find out how these billionaires made their riches - from the very start to the very top. No detail is too small, no story too wild and no business deal too shady for them to uncover. How did Amazon boss Jeff Bezos launch one of the biggest corporations of the internet age? How did six-time NBA champion Michael Jordan make a fortune from product endorsements with sports giant Nike? How did Rihanna come to sign with Jay-Z and to found a beauty product empire? And how did Chuck Feeney earn the title of 'the James Bond of philanthropy'?

With episodes examining Oprah Winfrey, Bill Gates, George Lucas and Kim Kardashian, these stories paint a vivid picture of business, entrepreneurship, capitalism and how our world really works.

But it's not just about how these billionaires made their money; it's about what they did with it next. Simon and Zing put each on trial to find out: is this billionaire a force for good or an agent of chaos? Or perhaps somewhere in between.... Join our hosts each week as they unravel tales of fortune, power, ambition and moral responsibility, and invite you to weigh in on the verdict: Good, Bad, or Just Another Billionaire?
